headline: Nvidia has 2 big 'upside opportunities' fueling long-term growth
summary: Nvidia's (NVDA) future still looks bright with new artificial intelligence (AI), robotics, and software opportunities on the horizon. Yahoo Finance Technology Editor Dan Howley and TECHnalysis Research president Bob O'Donnell join Market Domination to explain why Nvidia still has an edge despite growing competition from Advanced Micro Devices (AMD) and other tech giants building their own chips. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination here.

headline: AMD upgrade, HPE price target, Tesla robotaxi: Trending Tickers
summary: Advanced Micro Devices (AMD) was upgraded to Buy from Hold by HSBC and raised its price target to $200, highlighting the chipmaker's opportunity as an Nvidia (NVDA) rival. HPE (HPE) stock gains after Barclays lifted its price target for the stock, as enthusiasm about the company's recently closed deal with Juniper Networks (JNPR) reignites under the Trump administration. Tesla (TSLA) will expand its robotaxi service to San Francisco within the next two months, CEO Elon Musk said. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination here.

headline: Why Arm Holdings Gained 31% in the First Half of 2025
summary: The company continued to deliver solid growth on the top and bottom lines.  Shares of Arm Holdings (NASDAQ: ARM) continued to march higher in the first half of the year, benefiting from the broader tailwinds in artificial intelligence (AI), market share gains, and solid growth in its earnings report.  Arm, which licenses its central processing unit (CPU) architecture to partners like Apple and Nvidia, is well positioned to capitalize on the data center boom and future growth in edge AI, as its architecture is more power-efficient than the competing x86 alternative used by Intel and AMD.

headline: Ferrero–WK Kellogg deal, AMD upgrade, Tesla & Musk's AI chatbot
summary: Yahoo Finance's John Hyland tracks key market moves and stories on Thursday, July 10 in this episode of Market Minute. Ferrero confirmed it plans to buy WK Kellogg (KLG) for $3.1 billion in cash, putting Nutella, Froot Loops, and Frosted Flakes under one roof. Advanced Micro Devices (AMD) stock is climbing after HSBC upgraded the chipmaker to Buy from Hold and doubled its price target to $200. Tesla (TSLA) CEO Elon Musk announced that his artificial intelligence (AI) startup's chatbot will launch in Tesla vehicles next week. Stay up to date on the latest market action, minute-by-minute, with Yahoo Finance's Market Minute.

headline: Why AMD (AMD) Stock Is Trading Up Today
summary: Shares of computer processor maker AMD (NASDAQ:AMD) jumped 4.2% in the morning session after HSBC upgraded the stock and analysts expressed continued optimism about demand for artificial intelligence (AI) chips. HSBC analyst Frank Lee upgraded AMD from a "Hold" to a "Buy" rating, setting a new price target of $200. This new target suggests a significant potential upside from the stock's current levels.

headline: AMD & Roku upgraded, MP Materials skyrockets: Trending Tickers
summary: Advanced Micro Devices (AMD) stock is rising after HSBC analyst upgraded the stock to Buy and doubled its price target to $200. MP Materials (MP) stock skyrockets after the company announced a $400 million Department of Defense investment to boost US rare earth manufacturing. Roku (ROKU) stock is in focus after KeyBanc analyst upgraded the stock to Overweight from Sector Weight and raised his price target to $115, citing likely profitability by 2026 and continued ad growth boosting the stock's momentum. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Catalysts here.
